unnormalised: Delhi reports a spike in viral fever cases, because apparently, the mosquitoes didn't get the memo that monsoon season ended. Dr. Sharma from AIIMS says, "We're seeing a lot of patients with symptoms like fever, cough, and body ache." She added that 'basically, everyone's got the Delhi sniffles rn'. Outpatient dept. visits increased by 20% in the past week. Seems like everyone's trying to prepone their Diwali shopping, but fever's got other plans.
normalised: Delhi reports a spike in viral fever cases, because apparently, the mosquitoes didn't get the memo that monsoon season ended. Doctor Sharma from A-I-I-M-S says, "We're seeing a lot of patients with symptoms like fever, cough, and body ache." She added that 'basically, everyone's got the Delhi sniffles right now'. Outpatient department visits increased by twenty percent in the past week. Seems like everyone's trying to prepone their Diwali shopping, but fever's got other plans.

unnormalised: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has initiated fogging drives in several areas. Let's see if this actually works or if the mosquitoes are just laughing in Hindi. Health officials are advising people to take precautions like using mosquito repellent and avoiding stagnant water, basically stuff everyone already ignores until they're lying in bed with a fever of 102Â°F.
normalised: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (M-C-D) has initiated fogging drives in several areas. Let's see if this actually works or if the mosquitoes are just laughing in Hindi. Health officials are advising people to take precautions like using mosquito repellent and avoiding stagnant water, basically stuff everyone already ignores until they're lying in bed with a fever of one hundred and two degree Fahrenheit.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, some social media users have started a new trend of posting "fever selfies" with the hashtag #DelhiBellyAche, claiming it's the new "Delhi Fashion Week." Gotta love our resilience, even if it's fueled by paracetamol and the unwavering hope that the fever breaks before the family WhatsApp group starts diagnosing us with everything from dengue to chikungunya. Get well soon, Delhi!
